      • comparator

        @Nonnull
public static <T extends Comparable<? super T>> Comparator<T> comparator()
        Returns a convenience comparator which basically compares objects which implement the Comparable interface. The comparator is null safe in the manner, that nulls are always less than any non-nulls. To have a comparator which places nulls last, use the comparator0() method.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the element types to compare
        Returns:
        the comparator

      • comparator0

        @Nonnull
public static <T extends Comparable<? super T>> Comparator<T> comparator0()
        Returns a convenience comparator which basically compares objects which implement the Comparable interface. The comparator is null safe in the manner, that nulls are always greater than any non-nulls. To have a comparator which places nulls first, use the comparator() method.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the element types to compare
        Returns:
        the comparator

      • comparatorReverse

public static <T extends Comparable<? super T>> Comparator<T> comparatorReverse()

        Type Parameters:
        T - the element type, which must be self comparable
        Returns:
        the new comparator

      • max

        @Nonnull
public static <T extends Comparable<? super T>> Func2<T,T,T> max()
        Returns a function which returns the greater of its parameters. If only one of the parameters is null, the other parameter is returned. If both parameters are null, null is returned.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the parameter types, which must be self-comparable
        Returns:
        the function

      • max

        @Nonnull
public static <T> Func2<T,T,T> max(@Nonnull
                           Comparator<? super T> comparator)
        Returns a function which returns the greater of its parameters in respect to the supplied Comparator. If only one of the parameters is null, the other parameter is returned. If both parameters are null, null is returned.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the parameter types, which must be self-comparable
        Parameters:
        comparator - the value comparator
        Returns:
        the function

      • min

        @Nonnull
public static <T extends Comparable<? super T>> Func2<T,T,T> min()
        Returns a function which returns the smaller of its parameters. If only one of the parameters is null, the other parameter is returned. If both parameters are null, null is returned.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the parameter types, which must be self-comparable
        Returns:
        the function

public static <T> Func2<T,T,T> min(@Nonnull
                           Comparator<? super T> comparator)

        Type Parameters:

        Parameters:

      • sumBigDecimal

        @Nonnull
public static Func2<BigDecimal,BigDecimal,BigDecimal> sumBigDecimal()
        Retuns a function that adds two BigDecimal numbers and returns a new one.

        If the first parameter is null, it returns the second parameter.

        Returns:
        Function to sum integers in aggregators.
